properties.title: Bazaar Writers Salon
properties.description: Bazaar Writers Salon is a San Francisco reading series founded in 2012 by Peter Kline. The mission of Bazaar Writers Salon is to showcase the very best writing (poetry, fiction, and nonfiction) of the Bay Area and beyond, and to bring together some of the disparate Bay Area writing communities in a positive environment where everyone is welcome. This reading will feature Derrick Austin, Micah Ballard, Peter Bullen, Rita Bullwinkel, and Kathleen Winter.
properties.description_short: Bazaar Writers Salon is a San Francisco reading series founded in 2012 by Peter Kline. The mission of Bazaar Writers Salon is to showcase the very best writing of the Bay Area and beyond, and to bring together Bay Area writing communities in a positive environment.

properties.title: Organ Music: Dispatches From Our Insides
properties.description: Bodies gurgle, rumble, and leak. They channel ecstasies and metabolize histories. And who knows what’s going on inside those belly buttons. Join our workshop group of writers from The Ruby as they read from a wide variety of genres and styles, all related to the glorious, brilliant, messy, and strange human body. Novel about a traveling sideshow? Personal essay about demonic possession? The erotics of a blade gliding up a shin bone, skimming over a crotch? Get ready for it all…including a series of musical organ interludes! With Marya Brennan, Sarah Rose Cadorette, Kathryn Jaller, Kathleen J. Woods, and B. Lynn Woolman.
properties.description_short: Bodies gurgle, rumble, and leak. They channel ecstasies and metabolize histories. And who knows what’s going on inside those belly buttons. Join our workshop group of writers from The Ruby as they read from a wide variety of genres and styles, all related to the glorious, brilliant, messy, and strange human body.

properties.title: Red Light Lit
properties.description: Red Light Lit is devoted to writers who explore love, relationships, sexuality, identity, and gender. Since their founding in 2013, they have published 10 literary journals and produced over 100 live shows (including in Austin, Chicago, Los Angeles, Portland, San Francisco, and Seattle). In 2019, Red Light Lit published the poetry anthology Love Is the Drug & Other Dark Poems; and in 2020, it published Unearth [The Flowers] by Thea Matthews, its first single-author poetry collection.
properties.description_short: Red Light Lit is devoted to writers who explore love, relationships, sexuality, identity, and gender. Since their founding in 2013, they have published 10 literary journals and produced over 100 live shows.

properties.title: ZYZZYVA Fall All-Stars
properties.description: Zyzzyva presents readings from past and recent contributors to the journal of arts and letters founded in San Francisco in 1985. Featuring Jonathan Escoffery, Gabriela Garcia, Vanessa Hua, D.A. Powell, and Margaret Wilkerson Sexton. ZYZZYVA was founded in 1985 in San Francisco with the goal of publishing a superb literary journal shining a spotlight on West Coast poets, writers, and artists from a wide range of backgrounds, many of whom were otherwise overlooked by established publications, and providing them with a much needed platform. Since then, the journal has evolved into a nationally distributed, widely acclaimed publication showcasing contributors from across the country and around the world. In 2020, the journal marked 35 years of continuous publishing, celebrating more than three decades of enriching contemporary literature and supporting literary communities in the Bay Area and beyond.
properties.description_short: Zyzzyva presents readings from past and recent contributors to the journal of arts and letters founded in San Francisco in 1985. Featuring Jonathan Escoffery, Gabriela Garcia, Vanessa Hua, D.A. Powell, and Margaret Wilkerson Sexton.
properties.address: Dog Eared Books, 900 Valencia St, CA 94110

properties.title: The Fabulist presents: Here is the Future You Requested
properties.description: Join The Fabulist’s eclectic and wildly talented lineup of Bay Area writers for an evening of science fiction, fantasy and fantastical prose that explore utopian and dystopian tomorrows, as seen from the depths of our own pandemic-era techno-consumerist vortex.
properties.description_short: Join The Fabulist’s eclectic and wildly talented lineup of Bay Area writers for an evening of science fiction, fantasy and fantastical prose that explore utopian and dystopian tomorrows, as seen from the depths of our own pandemic-era techno-consumerist vortex.

properties.title: Lit Camp presents The Unreliable Narrator - Stories of Deception, Cluelessness and All-Out Lying
properties.description: Join Lit Camp as they present stories of deception, cluelessness and all-out lying. Lit Camp is a SF-based, nonprofit, juried writers conference held every year at Esalen in Big Sur, CA. Many of our alumni have gone on to publish best-selling books. For Lit Crawl 2021, Lit Camp is choosing one talented writer from of their six conferences to read a short piece written especially for the Crawl on the topic of Unreliable Narrator.
properties.description_short: Join Lit Camp as they present stories of deception, cluelessness and all-out lying. For Lit Crawl 2021, Lit Camp is choosing one talented writer from each of their six conferences to read a short piece written especially for the Crawl on the topic of Unreliable Narrator.
properties.address: Mission: Comics & Art, 2250 Mission St, CA 94110

properties.title: Noir at The Bar with the Mystery Writers of America
properties.description: Noir at the Bar is just what it sounds like—a chance for writers to read their works aloud at bars before an audience of readers, writers, and, erm, drinkers. It's a great way to introduce authors who might have slipped under the radar to a crowd of people who love crime fiction.

It's a great way to introduce authors who might have slipped under the radar to a crowd of people who love crime fiction.
